New Oxford Marching Band Places First at Hempfield

This past Saturday evening the New Oxford High School Marching Band placed first in the Liberty Conference at the Cavalcade of Bands competition held at Hempfield High School in Landisville, PA. New Oxford scored a 76.25 which placed them ahead of the bands from Warwick High School (71.65) and Big Spring High School (70.15). The Marching Colonials also brought home the specialty awards for Best Percussion and Best Color Guard in the Liberty Conference as well as the trophies for Best Overall Music and the Highest Score out of the 17 bands that attended this competition.

post_text: At 12:35 pm this afternoon, a note was found in a restroom at Conewago Valley Intermediate School which read "I'm bombing the school at 1:00". Students and staff were evacuated immediately to the high school auditorium by 12:50 pm. Eastern Adams Regional Police along with the Sheriff's Department were contacted and were on site before 1:00 pm. The Sheriff's Department utilized bomb sniffing dogs to check the interior of the building along with the perimeter. At 2:10 pm the building and perimeter were declared free from harm. Students were sent back to CVIS at approximately 2:15. Students will be dismissed at their regularly scheduled time. Students and staff were never in any danger. Thanks to the students and staff for an orderly evacuation and to the administration and local law enforcement for their assistance.

Last semester, NOHS students in a block three came together to purchase glasses for their peer who is color blind. Lauren Phillips, a junior, delivered a speech about the challenges of being color blind that brought the class to tears. She also delivered a business proposal about Enchroma, a company that makes glasses for color blind people to see color; however, the glasses are expensive and not covered by insurance. The students decided to come together and raise the funds for the glasses. For over a month, they planned for the moment when they would surprise her with the glasses. That moment happened Friday, February 3rd.

Teacher Christy Rehm stated, "Today I am so proud and humbled to work with the best students in the world, NOHS students!"
Gettysburg Times photo.

Students for October are Curtis Clinton from New Oxford High School and Katie Saylor from Bermudian Springs High School.
Curtis was presented by Keith Williams, Faculty Sponsor
Curtis is a member of the National Honor Society and has received distinguished honors. He is involved with Science Olympiad, Vex Robotics, Varsity Club and the Debate Team as well as a member of the cross country, swimming and track teams. He is also a swim instructor for the Special Olympics. Curtis is a mentor to other students. He serves as a volunteer for the Brethren Home and Habitat for Humanity. Curtis plans to join the Air Force Academy. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Clinton.

Colonial Classic
On Saturday, November 5th the New Oxford High School Band Boosters will host the 14th annual Colonial Classic band competition. Gates open at 2:30 and the show begins at 4:00. Tickets will only be sold at the gate and cost $10.00 for adults and $8.00 for students and senior citizens. A total of 17 bands will compete at this event and the evening will culminate with exhibition performances by the New Oxford High School Marching Band and the 250 member Towson University Marching Band.

New Oxford Marching Band News

This past Saturday evening the New Oxford High School Marching Band took second place out of seven bands in the Liberty Conference at the Cavalcade of Bands Association competition held at Manheim Central High School. New Oxford scored a 90.25 which placed them behind Susquehannock High School who scored a 92.95. East Pennsboro High School was third followed by Carlisle, South Western, Penn Manor and Francis Scott Key High Schools.

Congratulations NOMB members!!!!

Kirsten Jenkins, NOHS junior (NOMB - Mellophone) is also a member of the Cadets 2 Drum and Bugle Corps from Allentown, PA. On Sunday, September 4th the Cadets 2 were crowned Drum Corps Associates (DCA) World Champions at the Finals competition held in Rochester, NY. This is Kirsten's first year with C2 (as they are known in the activity) and their finals score was a 97.95.

In addition, Hunter Groft, NOHS senior (NOMB - Percussion) placed 2nd (97.25) as a member of the Reading Buccaneers Drum and Bugle Corps from Reading, PA. This is Hunter's first year with that corps.

School delays and cancelations, emergency information and information relevant to the day to day operation of our schools will be posted on the page.
That is not to say we won't use the page to celebrate significant accomplishments of our students or staff as is appropriate.
We hope the utilization of our Facebook page improves the overall communication between our schools and our community. Thank you.
